p: Culture is transferred from one generation to the next, and culture (as systems of beliefs) demarcates the prescribed behaviour of members of a sociocultural group (Douglas 1978; Olteda et al. 2004). More specifically, the manners in which people act are guided by the interaction between community members, and this interaction is influenced by various cultural beliefs (Legohérel et al. 2009). The cultural beliefs – convictions or tenets that people consider to hold true – that were investigated in this study are TO and SSC.
